{"conversationsMapping":{"CHAT_COMPLETION":[{"id":"a9a973c7-26e2-4472-ba43-6f1a26b51268","messages":[],"clientCode":"CHAT_COMPLETION","model":"gpt-3.5-turbo","createdOn":[2023,4,15,12,27,58,76939000],"updatedOn":[2023,4,15,12,27,58,76957000]},{"id":"03df0785-dda4-44c0-8889-dad0e6cd823e","messages":[{"prompt":"how can i resolve this problem of build error on my buil.gradle file : following is the build output ","response":"Incorrect API key provided: sk-HSGe4***************************************4iGX. You can find your API key at https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys."}],"clientCode":"CHAT_COMPLETION","model":"gpt-3.5-turbo","createdOn":[2023,4,15,12,27,58,78866000],"updatedOn":[2023,4,15,12,27,58,527989000]},{"id":"57c53747-b48c-4754-9bd3-7506bb81ea56","messages":[{"prompt":"Build file '/Users/andrianambinina/AndroidStudioProjects/AndroidLearning/dependencyInjection/DIDemo/app/build.gradle' line: 1

A problem occurred evaluating project ':app'.
> Failed to apply plugin 'com.android.internal.application'.
 > Android Gradle plugin requires Java 11 to run. You are currently using Java 1.8.
 Your current JDK is located in /Users/andrianambinina/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/corretto-1.8.0_282/Contents/Home/jre
 You can try some of the following options:
 - changing the IDE settings.
 - changing the JAVA_HOME environment variable.
 - changing `org.gradle.java.home` in `gradle.properties`.","response":"Incorrect API key provided: sk-HSGe4***************************************4iGX. You can find your API key at https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys."}],"clientCode":"CHAT_COMPLETION","model":"gpt-3.5-turbo","createdOn":[2023,4,15,12,28,1,688215000],"updatedOn":[2023,4,15,12,28,1,883989000]},{"id":"1cb313db-1dfb-497b-8d6c-cf12abc7a89b","messages":[{"prompt":"what is 1 plus 1","response":"Incorrect API key provided: sk-HSGe4***************************************4iGX. You can find your API key at https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys."}],"clientCode":"CHAT_COMPLETION","model":"gpt-3.5-turbo","createdOn":[2023,4,15,12,29,19,468273000],"updatedOn":[2023,4,15,12,29,19,750639000]},{"id":"36865790-16d5-4f88-b69e-154731328e11","messages":[{"prompt":"hello","response":"Hello! How can I assist you today?"}],"clientCode":"CHAT_COMPLETION","model":"gpt-3.5-turbo","createdOn":[2023,4,15,12,33,2,912773000],"updatedOn":[2023,4,15,12,33,4,362237000]},{"id":"a3cc5e36-5265-4c2e-b981-65d90e248ff9","messages":[{"prompt":"how can i resolve this problem of build error on my buil.gradle file : following is the build output 
Build file '/Users/andrianambinina/AndroidStudioProjects/AndroidLearning/dependencyInjection/DIDemo/app/build.gradle' line: 1

A problem occurred evaluating project ':app'.
> Failed to apply plugin 'com.android.internal.application'.
 > Android Gradle plugin requires Java 11 to run. You are currently using Java 1.8.
 Your current JDK is located in /Users/andrianambinina/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/corretto-1.8.0_282/Contents/Home/jre
 You can try some of the following options:
 - changing the IDE settings.
 - changing the JAVA_HOME environment variable.
 - changing `org.gradle.java.home` in `gradle.properties`.","response":"You need to update your Java version to 11 or higher to use the Android Gradle plugin, which requires Java 11. 

Here are some options you can try:
- Update your JDK to version 11 or higher
- Change the IDE settings to point to a different version of JDK that is installed on your machine
- Update the JAVA_HOME environment variable to point to a different version of JDK that is installed on your machine
- Update the `org.gradle.java.home` property in `gradle.properties` file located in the root directory of your project to point to a different version of JDK that is installed on your machine:

```groovy
org.gradle.java.home=/path/to/jdk11
``` 

Replace `/path/to/jdk11` with the path to your JDK 11 installation directory."}],"clientCode":"CHAT_COMPLETION","model":"gpt-3.5-turbo","createdOn":[2023,4,15,12,33,48,923058000],"updatedOn":[2023,4,15,12,34,0,451887000]},{"id":"9e33d3c1-dcaf-43ae-895f-cfeca3984909","messages":[{"prompt":"show me step by step how to update my JDK to version 11","response":"Sure, here are the steps to update your JDK to version 11:

1. Download the latest version of JDK 11 from the Oracle website. 
 - Go to https://www.oracle.com/java/technologies/javase-jdk11-downloads.html
 - Accept the license agreement and download the appropriate version for your operating system.

2. Install the downloaded JDK.
 - Follow the installer instructions to complete the installation.

3. Update your `PATH` environment variable.
 - Add the JDK 11 `bin` directory to your `PATH` variable. For example, if you installed JDK 11 in the default directory:
 ```
 export PATH=$PATH:/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk-11.0.9.jdk/Contents/Home/bin
 ```

4. Verify that the installation was successful by opening a command prompt/terminal and typing `java -version`. The output should show that you are running JDK 11.

That's it! You have successfully updated your JDK to version 11."}],"clientCode":"CHAT_COMPLETION","model":"gpt-3.5-turbo","createdOn":[2023,4,15,12,36,55,530530000],"updatedOn":[2023,4,15,12,37,11,342567000]},{"id":"65e316d6-d14f-4663-928e-5ddd1789459e","messages":[{"prompt":"how to update my `PATH` environment variable to change it to JDK 11","response":"To update the `PATH` environment variable to change it to JDK 11, follow these steps:

1. Find the location of your JDK 11 installation folder.

2. Open the System Properties dialog box by right-clicking on the "This PC" icon and selecting "Properties". Alternatively, you can press the Windows key + Pause/Break key to open the System Properties dialog box.

3. Click on the "Advanced system settings" link in the left-hand pane.

4. In the "System Properties" dialog box, click on the "Environment Variables" button.

5. In the "Environment Variables" window, under "System Variables", find the "Path" variable, and click on "Edit".

6. Add the path to your JDK 11 installation folder at the beginning of the "Variable Value" field. Separate it with a semicolon (;) from the previous entry.

7. Click "OK" to close all the windows.

Here's an example in Windows PowerShell where JDK 11 is installed in the `C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-11.0.12` folder:

```powershell
# Get current value of PATH variable
$existingPath = [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable("PATH", "Machine")

# Update the PATH variable to include JDK 11
$newPath = "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-11.0.12\bin;" + $existingPath
[Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable("PATH", $newPath, "Machine")
```

You will need to replace `C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-11.0.12` with the actual path to your JDK 11 installation folder."}],"clientCode":"CHAT_COMPLETION","model":"gpt-3.5-turbo","createdOn":[2023,4,15,13,38,27,478200000],"updatedOn":[2023,4,15,13,38,49,17867000]},{"id":"d3c5c949-c3f7-4423-90a1-7767238eaa6f","messages":[{"prompt":"how to update my `PATH` environment variable to change it to JDK 11 on mac","response":"You can update the `PATH` environment variable on macOS to use JDK 11 by following these steps:

1. Open Terminal (Applications -> Utilities -> Terminal)

2. Enter the command `nano ~/.bash_profile` to open your bash profile file in the nano text editor.

3. Add the following line at the end of the file to set the `PATH` variable to point to your JDK 11 installation:

 ```
 export PATH="/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk-11.0.1.jdk/Contents/Home/bin:$PATH"
 ```

 Note: Replace `/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk-11.0.1.jdk` with the path to your JDK 11 installation.

4. Press `Ctrl+X` to exit nano and save the changes.

5. Enter the command `source ~/.bash_profile` to apply the changes to your current session.

You should now be able to run `java -version` in a new Terminal window and see that it is"}],"clientCode":"CHAT_COMPLETION","model":"gpt-3.5-turbo","createdOn":[2023,4,15,13,39,17,918310000],"updatedOn":[2023,4,15,13,39,31,291242000]},{"id":"ef74fc37-82a2-4072-a621-962e4f3ee5e7","messages":[{"prompt":"how to purge cashed memorie on mac","response":"You can purge the cached memory on a Mac by following these steps:

1. Open the Terminal application.
2. Type the following command and press Enter:
```
sudo purge
```
3. Enter your admin password when prompted and press Enter.

This will immediately purge the cached memory on your Mac. It's important to note that this process may temporarily slow down your Mac, as it frees up memory that was being used by cache files. However, your Mac should quickly resume normal operation once the purge is complete."}],"clientCode":"CHAT_COMPLETION","model":"gpt-3.5-turbo","createdOn":[2023,4,15,13,44,18,447861000],"updatedOn":[2023,4,15,13,44,25,418344000]},{"id":"1a782cf9-e195-4246-a126-bdbf353e0e47","messages":[{"prompt":"give me a for mac terminal commande to find the path of Java 11 installation","response":"You can use the following command in Mac Terminal to find the path of Java 11 installation:

```bash
/usr/libexec/java_home -v 11
```

This will output the path of the Java 11 installation directory."}],"clientCode":"CHAT_COMPLETION","model":"gpt-3.5-turbo","createdOn":[2023,4,15,13,46,18,326945000],"updatedOn":[2023,4,15,13,46,22,74830000]}]}}

option.value:
{"id":"1a782cf9-e195-4246-a126-bdbf353e0e47","messages":[{"prompt":"give me a for mac terminal commande to find the path of Java 11 installation","response":"You can use the following command in Mac Terminal to find the path of Java 11 installation:

```bash
/usr/libexec/java_home -v 11
```

This will output the path of the Java 11 installation directory."}],"clientCode":"CHAT_COMPLETION","model":"gpt-3.5-turbo","createdOn":[2023,4,15,13,46,18,326945000],"updatedOn":[2023,4,15,13,46,22,74830000]}
